lines.text: [opening of the very first "New Price is Right" on September 4, 1972]

A fortune in fabulous prizes may go to these people today if they know when The Price is Right. Sandy Florinar, stand up. Paul Levine, stand up. Connie Dunnall, stand up. Myra Carter, stand up; and all four of you, come on down. You're the first contestants on "The New Price is Right!"
[theme plays]
Bob Barker!
[Bob enters to throngs of applauding people]

Oh, my, thank you, thank you so much, welcome to "The New Price is Right"; and let me assure you fans of the old "Price is Right" that this is your favorite game still based on the pricing of merchandise with wonderful awards for smart shoppers. We call it "The New Price is Right" because we have some exciting new games that you will enjoy right there at home with our studio audience, and we're going to get that first game going right now. Here's the first item up for bids on "The New Price is Right."
It's a fur coat.

[opening announcement]
Here it comes, from the Bob Barker Studio at CBS in Hollywood! Television's most exciting hour of fantastic prizes, the fabulous sixty-minute "Price is Right!"
" A Mark Goodson Television Production!
TICKETS "The Price is Right" CBS Television City 7800 Beverly Blvd. Los Angeles, CA 90036. Okay, Bob.
More pricing games after this announcement.
More pricing games coming up on the second half of The Price Is Right!

[just before the Range Finder in Range Game starts moving]
Don't press the button until you want to stop the Range Finder, because we can't start it again for thirty-seven hours.

[a contestant is playing Dice Game]
Do you have anything to say to daddy before we look at this number?
Nope, but I'd like to say a few things to God.

[Various openings from the fourth season with the shining, twinkling white lights border and the flashing credits, varying from "One Hour" and "Hour Power"; theme music play and audience cheers and applauds]
And here it is! The first ever hour-long game show in television! The fabulous new 60-minute "Price Is Right"!
[repeated line during Double Prices]
[to contestant]
Hold my hand.
[he/she does]
Say Alakazzam.
Alakazzam.
[Drew reveals price]
[Opening from 1976 to 1998; audience cheering]
Here it comes! Television's most exciting hour of fantastic prizes. The fabulous 60-minute "Price Is Right"!
[Announcer calls the names of the first four lucky members of the studio audience, using the phrase "Come On Down!"]

[after the fourth names is called]
You are the first four contestants on "The Price Is Right".
["The Price Is Right" theme song plays]
And now, here's the star of "The Price Is Right", Bob Barker!
[as Door #2 opens, Bob walks onto the stage; audience cheers and applauds; Janice Pennington hands Bob his microphone, then bows to the audience]

[to the camera]
Welcome to "The Price Is Right".
[repeated line]
Come on down! You're the next contestant on "The Price is Right."
[repeated at the end of every show]
help control the pet population. Have your pet spayed or neutered. Goodbye, everybody!

[to the winner and runner up during the showcase round]
The one of you who bids nearest to the actual retail price of your own showcase without going over will win it. But if you're the winner and are $250 or less away from the price of your showcase, we'll have the pleasure of giving you *both* showcases!
$11,999. You are over by $1!
[Her Dot Matrix marque reads over as the buzzer and failure horns play]
We got a double overbid. But however on the other hand, It's another historic moment. We never had a bidder on the Showcase Finals go over by just $1!
